<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of condition:
```c
static int condition(void)
{
	int ret;
	int ts_created;
	pthread_t tids[THREADS];

	/** TC1 consumer threads go first */
	/** create 10 consumer threads first */
	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL, tids,
				&ts_created);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** create 10 producer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** wait for consumer threads to finish */
	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);

	/** TC2 producer threads go first */
	/** create 10 producer threads first */
	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL, tids,
				&ts_created);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** create 10 consumer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

out:
	/** wait for producer threads to finish */
	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);
	return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
pthread_t tids[THREADS];
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 1.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Declaration of an array of pthread_t: pthread_t tids[THREADS]; does not in itself use any compiler language extension. pthread_t is a POSIX type (library type) and array declaration is standard C provided THREADS is a compile-time constant. This does not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2. (If THREADS were not a compile-time constant resulting in a variable-length array, that is a standard C99 feature — only report if your compiler explicitly documents VLA as a non‑standard extension.)
